text: Michael Francis McCormick (September 29, 1938 – June 13, 2020) was an American baseball pitcher who played 16 seasons in Major League Baseball (MLB). He played for the New York and San Francisco Giants, Baltimore Orioles, Washington Senators, New York Yankees and Kansas City Royals from 1956 to 1971. He batted and threw left-handed and was primarily a starting pitcher. McCormick died on June 13, 2020 in Cornelius, North Carolina from Parkinson's disease, aged 81.Mike McCormick, Giants’ first Cy Young Award winner, dies at 81 ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:National League All-Stars Category:New York Giants (NL) players Category:San Francisco Giants players Category:Baltimore Orioles players Category:Texas Rangers players Category:New York Yankees players Category:Kansas City Royals players Category:Baseball players from California Category:Sportspeople from Pasadena, California
title: Mike McCormick (pitcher)
